main event: A bluish light was sighted moving eastward at 500-600 mph, climbing from 1000 to 9000 ft and disappearing over Keflavík Air Force Base in Iceland.
interesting points: The object was observed for only 7 seconds by a USAF B-47 crew.
A similar radar return was observed on two separate occasions, one for 15 minutes and another for a shorter duration, near Keflavík Airport.
The radar returns were about the size of a small aircraft, moving at a constant speed of approximately 30 knots with an erratic course, generally heading north at an altitude of around 5,000 feet.
The pilot who had a visual sighting of a bright light matching the radar observations stated he had never seen anything like it before.
The investigating officer was convinced the sighting did not involve a known aircraft or material object and might have been an astronomical phenomenon.
